Event.name: Shooting_scenario
Event.definition: <def-root>A firearm is discharged, causing the motion of a projectile. This frame exists primarily to relate frames.</def-root>

Arg.name: Firearm
Arg.definition: <def-root>The device used by the <fen>Agent</fen> to cause the motion of the <fen>Projectile</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Projectile
Arg.definition: <def-root>The entity whose rapid, dangerous motion is caused by the Agent and/or Firearm.</def-root>

Arg.name: Agent
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen> is the person performing the intentional act causing the motion of the <fen>Projectile</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Distance
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE is any expression characterizing the extent of motion of the <fen>Projectile</fen>. <ex>Pat <t>threw</t> the Javelin <fex name="Distance">50 meters</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Goal
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE is the point at which the Theme ends up as a result of the motion. Kim <t>threw</t> the cat <fex name="Goal">into the garden</fex>. </def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>An act of the <fen>Agent</fen> whereby the rapid motion of the <fen>Projectile</fen> is achieved.</def-root>

Arg.name: Path
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE is any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a Source nor Goal. I <t>pushed</t> the trolley <fex name="Path">along the street</fex>. </def-root>

Arg.name: Source
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE is the starting point of motion. Pat dragged the box <fex name="Source">out of the cupboard</fex>. </def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition:
<def-root>A description of the state of the <fen>Agent</fen> or <fen>Projectile</fen> during the event.
<ex>He <t>shot</t> three arrows at the target, <fex name="dep">all unsuspecting as to why Harold had done so well</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Area
Arg.definition: <def-root>This frame element is used for expressions which describe a general area in which motion takes place when the motion is understood to be irregular or not to consist of a single, linear path. Locative setting adjuncts may also be assigned this frame element. Kim <t>pushed</t> the lawnmower <fex name="Area">around the garden</fex>. </def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The location in which the shooting event takes place.
<ex>The bankrobbers were crazy enough to <t>shoot</t> at the clerks with an AK-47 <fex name="Place">inside the bank</fex></ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Time</fen> when the shooting event takes place.
<ex>The robbers <t>shot</t> at the clerks <fex name="Time">as they ran out of the bank</fex></ex>
</def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen>'s purpose in launching the <fen>Projectile</fen>
<ex>We mistook a satellite <t>launched</t> <fex name="pur">to study earthquakes</fex> to be a missile, so we shot it down over the Pacific.</ex></def-root>
